page.title: 08PARLIAMENT ST.PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {Map Ref :-858052 { { }The school was built in{1883}and enjoyed a very successful centinary in {1983}. The school is built into the hill over-looking the centre of Stroud.The children attending the school come mainly from the area known as'top of town'. The children start school in the September following their fifth birthday and stay for{7}years before transfering to secondary school. The school is arranged in{7}classes one for each age group.There are{8} full-time staff and part time staff include a remedial teacher a welfare assistant and school secretary. Meals are cooked in the canteen and about a third of the children have a hot meal the rest bring sandwiches.
